Installation

  1. Install OpensceneryXwith the optional static aircraft and HD Forests selected. You can also download the complete compressed package here: OpenSceneryX.zip

    Warning: If you already have OpenScenryX installed, please rerun the installer and verify you are updated and have the otional static aircraft and forest replacement selected.
  2. Install the event scenery SimVenture 2020.zip
  3. Afer unzipping the event scenery, drag the folder into your Custom Scenery directory of X-Plane 11
What is this?

This scenery is a slightly modified fork of the fantastic scenery KOSH EAA AirVenture Oshkosh 2.7

The focus of these changes are to offer a consistent experience between connected users flying a specific scenario based VFR arrival procedure into KOSH. The biggest changes include replacing the existing draped ortho imagery, slightly extending the original bounds, and adding additional locations that are critical VFR reporting points. Generally scenery development minimizes this imagery in order to not interfere with other installed scenery or custom mesh + ortho imagery added by the user. In this context, we do want these areas to take priority so pilots are all looking at the same thing.

The ortho imagery included in this library is still very limited and does not cover the entire arrival. This is intentional in order to respect any custom scenery you may be running for the area. To get full route coverage you can install the optional Ortho4Xp package from the Ortho tab

Fon du Lac

Bing imagery, ZL19

Ripon area

Google imagery, ZL19

Fisk, Fisk Ave, KOSH

KOSH uses Bing ZL19, Fisk Google ZL19, Fisk Ave Bing ZL18

Optional Ortho4XP coverage

These bundled packages include more extensive photo realistic ortho imagery along the route. There are two versions you can pick from. The normal version includes both Bing/Google imagery of at least ZL 18, and ZL 19. The UltraHD version is even more aggressive with ZL19 along the arrival. Overlay

Installation
  1. pick zPE or zPE_UHD
  2. download all the .7z.00X files for the version you are interested in.
  3. after all files are downloaded, double click on the xx.7z.001 file. This will extract a single folder from the split .7z compressed files.
  4. drop the folder into your Custom Scenery.
  5. download, unzip, the overlays at the bottom yOrtho4XP_Overlays
  6. start x-plane
  7. quit x-plane
  8. open scenery_packs.ini and put zPE(_UHD) at the bottom, and yOrtho4XP_Overlays above it.
